column4: My backtick/tilde key only works if I hit it twice (not a dirty/sticky key -- consistently works if i hit it twice).  any ideas?
don't think so
otherwise i would think it wouldn't work consistently with two presses
you're using an international layout
no
try hitting it and then hitting Space
yes, that works
you're using an international layout - i insist
like US International, if you're in the US
If i hit the backtick key then space, it outputs the backtick.  OK, so it's international then, how do i change that?
try hitting it and then hitting the letter "n" - you'll probably see what this is about
I hit backtick then "n", nothing
meant tilde, not backtick. anyway you can also try backtick and then "a"
Yes, i tried backtick then 'a' and got an a with an accent
How do I turn off the international layout?

precisely. what's happening is that you have a keyboard layout that uses "combining" characters: if you hit ~ and then "n", you get ñ. if you hit ` and then "a", you get à. and several other combinations
i'm not on GNOME, but i have another computer that has it, so hold on a second and i'll check
Great, thanks
i can't find it precisely, as i don't have a US keyboard myself... but i really think it's a matter of selecting "US" instead of "US Intl", or instead of "US with dead keys", though i can only guess
Got it.  Thanks a million.  That was driving me nuts.  I looks like 'USA International (with dead keys)' was set up instead of 'USA (Default)'
yes, that would be it.
